title: Great Bromwich
content:
Greater Albion has just released ‘Great Bromwich’ at [MyFonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423184337/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/great-bromwich/).

Great Bromwich takes the ideas in Greater Albion’s Bromwich family that little bit further. It can be used on its own, or as a compliment to Bromwich. Great Bromwich uses specially re-designed large and small capitals, to enable that bold headline statement to be made with impressive Edwardian flair. In the spirit of railway travel posters and illustrated news journals, its a wonderful font for poster design, or for book covers and other work with a period theme.

There are some examples of ‘Great Bromwich’ in action on its own and alongside the Bromwich family on our [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20120423184337/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/).
author: Rasendyll

comments.content: Greater Albion seems to be releasing new typefaces twice a day!

Frank- actually were averaging about one a fortnight.

Nick- If you look on another thread here you'll see what's next is 'Clementhorpe', inspired by some lettering found in an old enamel advertisment for chocolate. The name 'Clementhorpe' is actually a roundabout hint of what chocolate was being advertised.
